summary: This document discusses a lawsuit filed against Jeffrey Epstein by a teenager and her family, alleging sexual abuse when she was 14 years old. Epstein's attorney denies the allegations, claiming they are motivated by financial gain. The article also mentions Epstein's legal troubles, including a felony charge for solicitation of prostitution.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is accused of sexually abusing a teenager and is facing a lawsuit and criminal charges related to solicitation of prostitution.

persons.name: Lilly Ann Sanchez
persons.context: Lilly Ann Sanchez is Epstein's attorney, who claims the allegations against him are false and motivated by money.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: Jane Doe is the teenager who filed a lawsuit against Epstein, alleging he sexually assaulted her when she was 14 years old.

persons.name: Jeffrey Herman
persons.context: Jeffrey Herman is the attorney representing Jane Doe in her lawsuit against Epstein.

persons.name: Gerald Lefcourt
persons.context: Gerald Lefcourt is Epstein's New York attorney who denied allegations in a separate case against Epstein.

connections.description: Lilly Ann Sanchez represents Jeffrey Epstein in his legal matters.
Jeffrey Herman is the attorney representing Jane Doe in her lawsuit against Epstein.
Jane Doe alleges that Jeffrey Epstein sexually assaulted her when she was 14 years old.
Gerald Lefcourt is another attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein in a separate legal case.

events.title: Alleged Sexual Assault
events.description: Jane Doe claims that Epstein sexually assaulted her during a massage at his Palm Beach mansion.

events.title: Lawsuit Filed
events.description: A lawsuit is filed against Epstein by Jane Doe and her family, seeking $50 million in damages for the alleged sexual abuse.

events.title: Felony Charge
events.description: Epstein faces a felony charge for solicitation of prostitution.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was accused of sexually abusing a teenager when she was 14 years old.
The lawsuit filed against Epstein seeks $50 million in damages.
Epstein's attorney, Lilly Ann Sanchez, claims the allegations are false and financially motivated.
Jane Doe's father has a criminal history involving fraud, having been sentenced to 21 months in federal prison.
Epstein faces a felony charge for solicitation of prostitution.
